post.description:
Ingest email with resume attachments for processing.

This endpoint receives emails with resume attachments and creates
background jobs for processing. Supports deduplication and multiple
file formats (PDF, PNG, JPG, TIFF).

Ingest email asynchronously using Celery task queue.

This endpoint queues email processing as a background task and
returns immediately with a task ID for status tracking.

schema.title: Response Ingest Email Async Email Ingest Async Post

Webhook endpoint for receiving raw email data.

This endpoint can be used by email services to send raw email data
directly to the ATS system for processing. Authentication is handled
via API key or other webhook-specific authentication.
Validate email message format without processing.

post.description:
Create a new candidate.

Creates a new candidate record with audit logging and automatic
client association based on the authenticated user's client.

get.description:
List candidates with optional filtering.

Supports filtering by name pattern, skills, and status.
Results are automatically filtered to the current client.

Get a specific candidate by ID.

Returns candidate details if the candidate belongs to the
current client, otherwise returns 404.

put.description:
Update a candidate's information.

Updates candidate data with audit logging. Only provided fields
are updated, others remain unchanged.

delete.description:
Delete a candidate.

Permanently deletes a candidate record with audit logging.
This is a hard delete operation.

get.description:
Find potential duplicate candidates.

Returns a list of candidates that might be duplicates of the
specified candidate based on name, email, and phone matching.

schema.title: Response Find Candidate Duplicates Candidates  Candidate Id  Duplicates Get

get.description:
Get candidate by email address.

Returns candidate with the specified email address within
the current client's context.

Get candidate statistics for the current client.

Returns summary statistics including total candidates,
status breakdown, and other metrics.

post.description:
Create a new application.

Creates a new application record with audit logging and automatic
client association based on the authenticated user's client.

get.description:
List applications with optional filtering.

Supports filtering by status, flagged status, and soft-deleted status.
Results are automatically filtered to the current client.

Get a specific application by ID.

Returns application details if the application belongs to the
current client, otherwise returns 404.

put.description:
Update an application's information.

Updates application data with audit logging. Only provided fields
are updated, others remain unchanged.

delete.description:
Soft delete an application.

Marks an application as deleted while preserving historical data.
This implements the soft delete requirement from the specifications.

post.description:
Restore a soft-deleted application.

Restores a previously soft-deleted application back to active status.

Flag an application for manual review.

Flags an application for manual review with a specified reason.
This is used by the duplicate detection system and manual processes.

Remove flag from an application.

Removes the flag from an application, allowing normal workflow progression.

put.description:
Update application status with workflow progression controls.

Updates application status while checking workflow progression rules.
Flagged applications may be blocked from certain status changes unless forced.

parameters.name: force_update

schema.description: Force update even if workflow progression is blocked

get.description:
Stream real-time events via Server-Sent Events.

Provides a persistent connection for real-time updates about applications,
candidates, and other system events. Supports automatic reconnection
with missed event replay.

Args:
    request: FastAPI request object
    last_event_id: Last event ID received (for reconnection handling)
    current_user: Authenticated user
    current_client: User's client (tenant)
    
Returns:
    StreamingResponse with SSE events

post.description:
Send a test event for SSE functionality testing.

This endpoint is useful for testing SSE connectivity and event delivery.
In production, events would be triggered by actual system changes.

Args:
    event_type: Type of test event
    message: Test message content
    application_id: Optional application ID for testing per-application ordering
    current_user: Authenticated user
    current_client: User's client (tenant)
    db: Database session
    
Returns:
    Success confirmation

get.description:
Get SSE system metrics and performance data.

Returns metrics about SSE performance, connection counts, latency,
and other operational data for monitoring and alerting.

Args:
    current_user: Authenticated user
    current_client: User's client (tenant)
    
Returns:
    SSE metrics dictionary

Check SSE system health and connectivity.

Verifies that the SSE system is operational, Redis is connected,
and the system can handle new connections.

Args:
    current_user: Authenticated user
    current_client: User's client (tenant)
    
Returns:
    Health status information
